subject: Sexual Health
title: STI Stigma and Science
description: A fast breakdown of STI Stigma and Science for builders.

hook.text: Shame keeps millions from getting tested. Stigma around STIs is itself a public health crisis.

buildup.text: Historically, STIs were treated as punishment for immoral behavior rather than medical conditions.

discovery.text: Modern science shows STIs are infections like any other, caused by pathogens, not personal failings.

twist.text: Countries that reduced stigma saw testing rates climb and infection rates drop significantly.

climax.text: Fighting stigma with facts is one of the most effective public health strategies available.

punchline.text: Shame spreads disease. Knowledge stops it.

quiz.question: What happened in countries that reduced STI stigma?
options: Testing rates rose and infections dropped
